title: Clinical Deterioration Risk
explanation: Patient demonstrates high risk for clinical deterioration. Persistent fever and tachycardia despite 48+ hours of antibiotics raises concern for treatment failure or complications. Worsening renal function may indicate sepsis or volume depletion. Anemia combined with infection increases risk. Recommend: repeat chest imaging to assess for complications, blood cultures if not already done, consider ICU-level monitoring, nephrology consult for acute kidney injury, and broadening antibiotic coverage if no improvement.
